alert.note: Alert for Kittitas Valley; Lower Columbia Basin of Washington; Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Yakima Valley (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 05 at 5:34AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...RISES ON STREAMS AND RIVERS WILL CONTINUE DUE TO SNOWMELT AND PRECIPITATIOON... Streams and rivers emanating from the mountains will continue to see rises today through early next week. A low pressure system from California will sit over the forecast area today and bring another round of rainfall, leading to rises in streams and rivers with several gauges forecasted to meet or exceed bankfull over the weekend. The most recent flood forecast for our area rivers has trended downward since Thursday, however steady showers on Friday are expected to lead to streams and rivers cresting by late this weekend into the start of next work week. So far, only Imnaha and John Day at Service Creek are forecasted to reach flood stage, but that may change should prolonged showers impact the eastern mountains and foothills of the Cascades. Stay tuned to the latest updates on the flood forecast through the weekend at weather.gov/pdt.

area.areaDesc: Kittitas Valley; Lower Columbia Basin of Washington; Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Yakima Valley
